newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: New Toyo International to list in Singapore.
newsitem.headline: New Toyo International to list in Singapore.

text.p: Singapore-based paper products manufacturer New Toyo International Holdings Pte Ltd said on Tuesday it has received approval in principle to list on the main board of the Stock Exchange of Singapore (SES).
New Toyo said in a statement its main products were laminated aluminum paper used for packaging brand name consumer products, non-carbon paper, and corrugated carbon boxes.
It said the group posted net profits of Singapore $10.1 million on turnover of S$127.4 million last year, up from S$7.0 million profit in 1992 on turnover of S$77.7 million in 1992.
"The listing will enhance the group's position as one of the largest independent producers of laminated products in the region," executive chairman Yen Wen Hwa said.
"More significantly, it will fuel our next phase of regionalisation and growth in some of the region's high growth markets," he added.
The group began supplying laminated packaging material to the Singapore and Indonesian tea and cigarette industries in 1975.
It has manufacturing operations in Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Vietnam, and China.
